alert.note: Alert for Brown; Coleman; Runnels (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 10:31PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Brown, Coleman and southern Runnels Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1029 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms over southern Runnels, all of Coleman, and northern Brown counties, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Coleman, Ballinger, Santa Anna, Miles, Gouldbusk, Lake Brownwood Near Thrifty, Burkett, May, Cross Cut, Glen Cove, Rockwood, Hatchel, Voss, Lake Brownwood State Park, Silver Valley, Leaday, Rowena, Lake Brownwood, Benoit and Byrds. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
